d44def57-5f64-45c5-b004-9ce141ea0448.name: The Great Gatsby
d44def57-5f64-45c5-b004-9ce141ea0448.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
d44def57-5f64-45c5-b004-9ce141ea0448.description: Set in the Jazz Age, this classic novel explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream through the eyes of Jay Gatsby.

02df6084-1ef9-42fd-91df-083243c213a4.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
02df6084-1ef9-42fd-91df-083243c213a4.author: Harper Lee
02df6084-1ef9-42fd-91df-083243c213a4.description: Harper Lee's masterpiece addresses racial injustice in the American South during the 1930s through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

997a2257-1c72-4194-8543-ff40b2a4c269.author: George Orwell
997a2257-1c72-4194-8543-ff40b2a4c269.description: A dystopian novel that explores the consequences of a totalitarian regime, thought control, and the nature of truth.

657729f7-b03d-456a-9b72-ab16d9cfc689.name: The Hobbit
657729f7-b03d-456a-9b72-ab16d9cfc689.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
657729f7-b03d-456a-9b72-ab16d9cfc689.description: Journey with Bilbo Baggins as he sets out on an epic quest filled with dwarves, dragons, and magical adventures in Middle-earth.

5499bae8-6149-4893-aa2d-67e3a133eb20.name: The Girl on the Train
5499bae8-6149-4893-aa2d-67e3a133eb20.author: Paula Hawkins
5499bae8-6149-4893-aa2d-67e3a133eb20.description: A psychological thriller that follows the lives of three women and their connections to a mysterious disappearance.
